HRFLOW_AUTH_SETTINGS_PREFIX = "hrflow_auth_"
PULL_PARAMETERS_SETTINGS_PREFIX = "pull_parameters_"
PUSH_PARAMETERS_SETTINGS_PREFIX = "push_parameters_"

# << format_placeholder >>

# << logics_placeholder >>

# << callback_placeholder >>



def workflow(
        
        settings: dict
    ) -> None:
    if "__workflow_id" not in settings:
        return Bullhorn.archive_profiles_in_hrflow(
            workflow_id="",
            connector_auth=dict(),
            hrflow_auth=dict(),
            pull_parameters=dict(),
            push_parameters=dict(),
            init_error=ActionInitError(
                reason=Reason.workflow_id_not_found,
                data=dict(error="__workflow_id not found in settings", settings_keys=list(settings.keys())),
            )
        )
    workflow_id = settings["__workflow_id"]

    

    connector_auth = dict()
    for parameter in ('client_id', 'client_secret', 'password', 'username'):
        parameter_name = "{}{}".format(CONNECTOR_AUTH_SETTINGS_PREFIX, parameter) 
        if parameter_name in settings:
            connector_auth[parameter] = settings[parameter_name]
        

    hrflow_auth = dict()
    for parameter in ('api_secret', 'api_user'):
        parameter_name = "{}{}".format(HRFLOW_AUTH_SETTINGS_PREFIX, parameter)
        if parameter_name in settings:
            hrflow_auth[parameter] = settings[parameter_name]
        

    pull_parameters = dict()
    for parameter in ('limit', 'last_modified_date', 'query', 'fields'):
        parameter_name = "{}{}".format(PULL_PARAMETERS_SETTINGS_PREFIX, parameter)
        if parameter_name in settings:
            pull_parameters[parameter] = settings[parameter_name]
        

    push_parameters = dict()
    for parameter in ('source_key',):
        parameter_name = "{}{}".format(PUSH_PARAMETERS_SETTINGS_PREFIX, parameter)
        if parameter_name in settings:
            push_parameters[parameter] = settings[parameter_name]
        

    incremental = settings.get("__incremental")

    return Bullhorn.archive_profiles_in_hrflow(
        workflow_id=workflow_id,
        connector_auth=connector_auth,
        hrflow_auth=hrflow_auth,
        pull_parameters=pull_parameters,
        push_parameters=push_parameters,
        logics=globals().get("logics"),
        format=globals().get("format"),
        callback=globals().get("callback"),
        incremental=incremental == "enable",
    )

client_id.description: A unique ID displayed under Self Client > Client Secret.

client_secret.description: A unique confidential secret displayed under Self Client > Client Secret.

authorization_code.description: The authorization code generated during the Self Client creation, used to get the refresh token and the first access token.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token is used to generate a new access token when the current access token expires.

zoho_accounts_url.description:
Zoho CRM is hosted at multiple data centers. Therefore, the API domain URL varies for each data center.
You must use your domain-specific Zoho Accounts URL to generate access and refresh tokens. The following are the various domains and their corresponding accounts URLs.
 US: https://accounts.zoho.com
 AU: https://accounts.zoho.com.au
 EU: https://accounts.zoho.eu
 IN: https://accounts.zoho.in
 CN: https://accounts.zoho.com.cn
 JP: https://accounts.zoho.jp
 CA: https://accounts.zohocloud.ca

api_secret.description: API Key used to access HrFlow.ai API

api_user.description: User email used to access HrFlow.ai API

fields.description:
To list all the module records with respect to fields
Multiple field API names, comma-separated.
For example Last_Name, Email

sort_order.description:
To sort the available list of records in either ascending or descending order
asc - ascending order
desc - descending order

sort_by.description:
To sort the available list of records based on the given field
Field API name
Example: Email

cvid.description:
To get the list of records based on custom views
{custom_view_id}

territory_id.description:
To get the list of records based on territory
{territory_id}

include_child.description:
To include records from the child territories.
True includes child territory records.
False does not include child territory records.
The default value is false.

state.description:
If the value of this parameter is 'draft', then the response will only contain Draft records from the specified module. If the parameter's value is 'save', then the response will return saved records from the specified module.

If this parameter is not included in your request body, then the response will only return saved records from the specified module.

converted.description:
To get the list of converted records.
The default value is false
true - get only converted records
false - get only non-converted records
both - get all records

approved.description:
To get the list of approved records.
The default value is true
true - get only approved records
false - get only non-approved records
both - get all records

fields.description:
To list all the module records with respect to fields
Multiple field API names, comma-separated.
For example Last_Name, Email

sort_order.description:
To sort the available list of records in either ascending or descending order
asc - ascending order
desc - descending order

sort_by.description:
To sort the available list of records based on the given field
Field API name
Example: Email

cvid.description:
To get the list of records based on custom views
{custom_view_id}

territory_id.description:
To get the list of records based on territory
{territory_id}

include_child.description:
To include records from the child territories.
True includes child territory records.
False does not include child territory records.
The default value is false.

state.description:
If the value of this parameter is 'draft', then the response will only contain Draft records from the specified module. If the parameter's value is 'save', then the response will return saved records from the specified module.

If this parameter is not included in your request body, then the response will only return saved records from the specified module.

converted.description:
To get the list of converted records.
The default value is false
true - get only converted records
false - get only non-converted records
both - get all records

approved.description:
To get the list of approved records.
The default value is true
true - get only approved records
false - get only non-approved records
both - get all records

updated_at.description: type: datetime ISO8601, Last update date of the Job.

created_at.description: type: datetime ISO8601, Creation date of the Job.

certifications.description: list of certifications of the Job.

tasks.description: list of tasks of the Job

tags.description: list of tags of the Job

metadatas.description: list of metadatas of the Job

fields.description: other location attributes like country, country_code etc

name.description: Identification name of a Section of the Job. Example: culture

title.description: Display Title of a Section. Example: Corporate Culture

description.description: Text description of a Section: Example: Our values areNone

type.description: Type of the skill. hard or soft

value.description: Value associated to the skill
Value associated to the Object's name

name.description: Identification name of a Range of floats attached to the Job. Example: salary

unit.description: Unit of the value. Example: euros.

name.description: Identification name of a Range of dates attached to the Job. Example: availability.

value_min.description: Min value in datetime ISO 8601, Example: 500.

value_max.description: Max value in datetime ISO 8601, Example: 1000

workflow.pull_template:
import typing as t

from hrflow_connectors.v2 import ZohoRecruit
from hrflow_connectors.v2.core.run import ActionInitError, Reason

CONNECTOR_AUTH_SETTINGS_PREFIX = "connector_auth_"
HRFLOW_AUTH_SETTINGS_PREFIX = "hrflow_auth_"
PULL_PARAMETERS_SETTINGS_PREFIX = "pull_parameters_"
PUSH_PARAMETERS_SETTINGS_PREFIX = "push_parameters_"

# << format_placeholder >>

# << logics_placeholder >>

# << callback_placeholder >>



def workflow(
        
        settings: dict
    ) -> None:
    if "__workflow_id" not in settings:
        return ZohoRecruit.archive_jobs_in_hrflow(
            workflow_id="",
            connector_auth=dict(),
            hrflow_auth=dict(),
            pull_parameters=dict(),
            push_parameters=dict(),
            init_error=ActionInitError(
                reason=Reason.workflow_id_not_found,
                data=dict(error="__workflow_id not found in settings", settings_keys=list(settings.keys())),
            )
        )
    workflow_id = settings["__workflow_id"]

    

    connector_auth = dict()
    for parameter in ('client_id', 'client_secret', 'authorization_code', 'refresh_token', 'zoho_accounts_url'):
        parameter_name = "{}{}".format(CONNECTOR_AUTH_SETTINGS_PREFIX, parameter) 
        if parameter_name in settings:
            connector_auth[parameter] = settings[parameter_name]
        

    hrflow_auth = dict()
    for parameter in ('api_secret', 'api_user'):
        parameter_name = "{}{}".format(HRFLOW_AUTH_SETTINGS_PREFIX, parameter)
        if parameter_name in settings:
            hrflow_auth[parameter] = settings[parameter_name]
        

    pull_parameters = dict()
    for parameter in ('type',):
        parameter_name = "{}{}".format(PULL_PARAMETERS_SETTINGS_PREFIX, parameter)
        if parameter_name in settings:
            pull_parameters[parameter] = settings[parameter_name]
        

    push_parameters = dict()
    for parameter in ('board_key',):
        parameter_name = "{}{}".format(PUSH_PARAMETERS_SETTINGS_PREFIX, parameter)
        if parameter_name in settings:
            push_parameters[parameter] = settings[parameter_name]
        

    incremental = settings.get("__incremental")

    return ZohoRecruit.archive_jobs_in_hrflow(
        workflow_id=workflow_id,
        connector_auth=connector_auth,
        hrflow_auth=hrflow_auth,
        pull_parameters=pull_parameters,
        push_parameters=push_parameters,
        logics=globals().get("logics"),
        format=globals().get("format"),
        callback=globals().get("callback"),
        incremental=incremental == "enable",
    )
